function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Indoor Environment Quality (IEQ) monitoring systems are necessary to detect energy-waste situations and contribute to developing solutions. Since this is a worldwide problem, it is important to achieve versatile and low-cost IEQ monitoring systems that are easy to implant in different buildings.","Impact":"Without effective IEQ monitoring systems, energy waste and poor indoor air quality could persist, leading to increased risk of contagious disease propagation.","Mitigation":"Implementation of versatile and low-cost IEQ monitoring systems alongside effective energy management solutions.","Technologies":"IoT-based monitoring systems, energy management systems, efficient appliances, and materials for better isolation.","People":"Occupants of public buildings, especially in offices and public spaces.","Owner":"Building managers, facility management teams, and environmental health and safety departments."},{"Description":"The problem of energy waste, typically found in offices and public buildings, was presented to the students of the B.Sc. Degree in Industrial Electronics and Automation Engineering for raising awareness about the SDGs and encouraging sustainability.","Impact":"Lack of awareness and action on energy waste could lead to inefficient resource use and increased environmental impact, including the potential for poor indoor air quality and disease transmission.","Mitigation":"Educational initiatives and practical projects that raise awareness about sustainable practices and encourage the development of energy-efficient technologies.","Technologies":"IoT-based monitoring systems, energy efficiency technologies, and sustainable building materials.","People":"Students, academic institutions, and future engineers.","Owner":"Educational institutions, sustainability organizations, and industry partners."},{"Description":"The work describes a full IoT scalable architecture aimed at monitoring indoor environmental quality inside public buildings, such as university faculties, which runs over existing communication infrastructures.","Impact":"Inadequate indoor environmental monitoring could lead to poor air quality and an increased risk of disease transmission within public buildings, especially in densely populated areas like university campuses.","Mitigation":"Implementation of a scalable IoT architecture for continuous monitoring and analysis of indoor environmental quality, supported by effective management of communication infrastructures.","Technologies":"IoT-based monitoring systems, communication infrastructures, and data analytics for environmental quality assessment.","People":"Occupants of public buildings, university communities, and facility management teams.","Owner":"Building managers, university administrations, and IT departments."}]}
